call_title: Sigma Trees | Alex Chepurnoy | Ergoversary Summit 2024

topics.title: Ergo Contractual Layer History and Evolution
topics.summary: Alexander Chepurnoy presents the historical development of Ergo's Sigma contractual layer from initial design in 2016-2017 through mainnet launch in 2019 to current 6.0 development. He covers key milestones including ErgoScript emergence in 2018, JIT costing in 5.0 release, and upcoming 6.0 improvements.

topics.title: Ergo Ecosystem Applications Built with Sigma
topics.summary: Overview of applications built on Ergo using Sigma trees including Ergo Mixer, Oracle Pools, stablecoins like SigmaUSD, DEXes, lending protocols, and bridging solutions. Highlights both trustless Bitcoin-Ergo relay and federated Rosen Bridge implementations.

topics.title: Sigma Protocol Foundations and Multi-Signature Trees
topics.summary: Detailed explanation of how Sigma protocols enable flexible multi-signature schemes using tree structures. Covers zero-knowledge properties where external observers cannot determine which parties signed in OR/threshold conditions, preserving privacy while maintaining security.

topics.title: Blockchain Context Integration and Time Locks
topics.summary: Evolution from simple signature statements to complex computations incorporating blockchain context like block heights and time locks. Explains how visual tools like Blockly enable non-coding construction of signature statements combined with blockchain conditions.

topics.title: Contract Compilation and Tree Execution Model
topics.summary: Technical deep-dive into how ErgoScript contracts compile to Sigma trees stored on blockchain and execute by reducing to signature statements using blockchain context. Explains why Ergo has unified model where everything is a contract rather than separate accounts and contracts.

topics.title: Sidechain and Layer 2 Extensions
topics.summary: Exploration of extending Sigma trees beyond Ergo mainchain including merge-mined sidechains with mainchain context, private consortium blockchain timestamping, and enhanced layer 2 solutions. Discusses trustless pegging mechanisms and conditional spendability based on layer 2 states.

topics.title: Digital Smart Cash and Non-Blockchain Applications
topics.summary: Vision for applying Sigma tree model to non-blockchain digital cash systems and statement voting mechanisms. Argues this tree-based approach is more natural for cash systems than virtual machine models, as it directly answers whether digital coins can be spent with provided signatures.
